actions-list.actionItem: The House has concluded all anticipated legislative business and has proceeded to Special Order speeches.
The House proceeded with further one minute speeches.
The Chair announced that the Chair's earlier announcement regarding roll call number 61 was mistaken. The correct tally was 221 voting "aye," 202 voting "no," and 1 answering "present."

Mrs. Miller (IL) asked unanimous consent That, when the House adjourns on Thursday, March 6, 2025, it adjourn to meet at noon for Morning-Hour debate and 2 p.m. for legislative business. Agreed to without objection.
Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.
On agreeing to the resolution Agreed to without objection.
Considered by unanimous consent. H. Res. 190 — "Electing Members to the Joint Committee of Congress on the Library and the Joint Committee on Printing."
Mrs. Miller (IL) asked unanimous consent to discharge from committee and consider.
The House convened, returning from a recess continuing the legislative day of March 6.
The Speaker announced that the House do now recess. The next meeting is subject to the call of the Chair.
Pursuant to the provisions of H. Res. 189, Mr. Green of Texas presented himself in the well of the House for the purpose of administration of censure by the Speaker of the House.
Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.

actions-list.header: On agreeing to the resolution Agreed to by the Yeas and Nays: 224
actions-list.actionItem: 198, 2 Present (Roll no. 62).
Considered as unfinished business. H. Res. 189 — "Censuring Representative Al Green of Texas."
Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.

actions-list.header: On passage Passed by the Yeas and Nays: 221
actions-list.actionItem: 202, 1 Present (Roll no. 61).
The previous question was ordered pursuant to the rule.
The House proceeded with one hour of debate on S.J. Res. 11.

Rule provides for consideration of H.J. Res. 42, H.J. Res. 61 and S.J. Res. 11. The resolution provides for consideration of H.J. Res. 42, H.J. Res. 61, and S.J. Res. 11 under a closed rule with one of general debate on each measure. The resolution also provides for one motion to recommit on H.J. Res. 42 and H.J. Res. 61 and one motion to commit on S.J. Res. 11.

Considered under the provisions of rule H. Res. 177. S.J. Res. 11 — "Providing for congressional disapproval under chapter 8 of title 5, United States Code, of the rule submitted by the Bureau of Ocean Energy Management relating to "Protection of Marine Archaeological Resources"."
The House proceeded with one minute speeches, which by direction of the Chair would be limited to 5 per side of the aisle.
The Chair designated Mr. Wied to lead the Members in reciting the Pledge of Allegiance to the Flag.
The Speaker announced approval of the Journal.  Pursuant to clause 1, rule I, the Journal stands approved.
Today's prayer was offered by Pastor Frank Rice, Mount Calvary Free Will Baptist Church, Hookerton, North Carolina.
The House convened, starting a new legislative day.
